page.title: 01THE RIPLEY-HEAGE AREA.
page.content: The area includes the west half of the town of Ripley and extends west to the village of Heage,and south to the hamlets of Street Lane,Marehay and the outskirts of Belper.The underlying Coal Measures give a landscape of low ridges draining S.W.to the River Derwent in Belper.The Coal Measures have also shaped the human landscape with the growth of mining settlements in the 19th Century,old workings of iron and coal and in the past 40 years opencast mining.Today industry is limited to small light units.Although now predominately a farming area,the Coal Measures have a further effect giving low grade farm land resulting from the underlying clays and the effects of opencast coal mining.
